subject: Art & Design
title: Co-Branding: When Two Brands Unite
description: A short lesson to help you apply Co-Branding: When Two Brands Unite.

hook.text: Nike plus Apple created Nike+. When two brands join forces, the result can be bigger than either alone.

buildup.text: Co-branding pairs complementary brands to share audiences, split costs, and create products neither could alone.

discovery.text: Great co-brands share values but not products. GoPro and Red Bull both sell adventure â€” cameras and energy drinks.

twist.text: A failed co-brand can damage both partners. Lego and Shell ended their partnership after Greenpeace protests.

climax.text: Doritos and Taco Bell merged their products into the Doritos Locos Taco â€” selling over a billion units in two years.

punchline.text: Co-branding multiplies trust. Or multiplies the damage.

quiz.question: What makes a co-branding partnership most effective?
options: Partners that share values but offer different products to complementary audiences
Two brands in the exact same market category
The larger brand absorbing the smaller one completely
